results.title: Henry Bolte speech at opening of relocated Dandenong Stock Market (1958)
results.brief_description:
Silent film footage of the then Premier of Victoria, Henry Bolte, presenting his speech at the opening of the Dandenong Stock Market at its new location in Cheltenham Road (1958). Includes scenes of dignitaries and spectators, and a tour of the stockyards.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
THIS FILM IS SILENT

results.title: Henrik Ibsen
results.creator_credit: Nigel Wattis and London Weekend Television
results.brief_description: Narrated by Michael Meyer, this discussion of the controversial career of playwright, Henrik Ibsen, covers both biographical details of the writer and delineates the four significant stages in his writing through a comprehensive study of the themes and the sociological and political impact of his work and its part in changing the face of live theatre. His characteristic questioning of authority and tradition and demands for debate on issues in wider society through his work is evoked and discussed. As is the powerful turning point in theatre his approach to writing and acting influenced, with discussion of his scripts about ordinary people that turned theatre into a mirror on society and encouraged relational acting instead of grand solo performances in larger than life show pieces that had previously dominated the theatrical scene. Through the program’s commentary, interviews with other writers and academics, through readings of his work, including his letters and diaries, and excerpts from performances of his renowned plays this documentary provides a thorough analysis of the influential work of Henrik Ibsen as well as a contextual insight into the more personal life of this powerful writer.

results.title: Henri Gaudier-Brzeska
results.brief_description: A documentary on the sculptures and drawings of the young Vorticist sculptor who was killed in World War I at the age of 23. The film emphasises Gaudier-Brzeska’s involvement with the Vorticist movement and Ezra Pound. Gaudier-Brzeska’s statements on sculpture are drawn from his extensive correspondence and contributions to “Blast”, the vorticist magazine. Much of the narration is drawn from the artists writings on his art.

results.title: Hen hop (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A cartoon film in which a hen, sometimes a Leghorn, at other times a Plymouth Rock, and even an egg with feet, dance to the old time waltzes and reels of French-Canadian barn dance music. A cartoon film hand-drawn with pen and ink by Norman McLaren, with colour added optically. Used to publicise a Victory Bond drive.

results.title: Hemingway
results.creator_credit: Julian Claman, McGraw-Hill Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: Chronicles the life of the American Nobel Prize winner, from boyhood through his years as a journalist and novelist until his death. Major literary and artistic personalities are seen including James Joyce, Gertrude Stein, Pablo Picasso, Lincoln Steffens, and F. Scott Fitzgerald. Documents the turbulent times of World War I, World War II and the Spanish Civil War and his participation.

results.title: Helping the child face the don'ts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Personality Development”.
Shows that personality is shaped in children by conforming to the “don’ts” imposed by parents and the society in which we live. Typical situations showing the child in relation to his environment are shown.
